column4: Union calls new strikes at Amazon's German warehouses
column5: BERLIN Workers at German warehouses of U.S. online retailer Amazon.com Inc  were called out on strike by labor union Verdi on Wednesday as part of a long-running dispute over pay and conditions.

column4: Investors see Biogen CEO choice as friendly to potential takeover
column5: NEW YORK The surprise selection of Michel Vounatsos to run Biogen Inc signals a shift toward a more commercial management focus after years of targeting ambitious scientific gains  and likely keeps the U.S. biotech in play as a takeover target.

column4: Facebook inks agreement with 17 universities to streamline research
column5: WASHINGTON Facebook Inc's hardware development division on Wednesday announced a new partnership with Harvard  Princeton and 15 other universities intended to allow swifter collaboration on technology research projects.

column4: Inovio Zika vaccine evokes robust response in early human study
column5: Inovio Pharmaceuticals Inc said its experimental Zika vaccine induced robust immune responses in an early-stage study in human volunteers who have not been infected with the virus.

column4: Merrimack ends breast cancer drug study over likely futility
column5: Merrimack Pharmaceuticals Inc said it would stop a study testing its drug in advanced breast cancer patients  after an analysis suggested the drug would unlikely show superiority over chemotherapy.

column4: Chipmaker Micron's forecast powered by improving PC market
column5: Micron Technology Inc  forecast current-quarter revenue and profit above estimates as a stabilizing PC market spurs demand and boosts prices of its memory chips.

column4: Hacker group takes over Netflix Twitter account
column5: One of Netflix Inc's  Twitter accounts was hacked on Wednesday by an entity calling itself "OurMine".

column4: Viacom unit head overseeing MTV  Comedy Central to leave
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Longtime Viacom Inc  executive Doug Herzog  who oversees the networks Comedy Central and MTV  is leaving the company next month  according to a memo to employees sent Wednesday from chief executive Bob Bakish.

column4: Viacom unit head overseeing MTV  Comedy Central to leave
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Longtime Viacom Inc  executive Doug Herzog  who oversees the networks Comedy Central and MTV  is leaving the company next month  according to a memo to employees sent Wednesday from chief executive Bob Bakish.

column4: Anadarko to sell certain Marcellus assets for $1.24 billion
column5: Oil and gas producer Anadarko Petroleum Corp  said it would sell certain natural gas assets in the Marcellus shale for about $1.24 billion to a unit of Alta Resources Development LLC.

column4: Anadarko to sell certain Marcellus assets for $1.24 billion
column5: Oil and gas producer Anadarko Petroleum Corp  said it would sell certain natural gas assets in the Marcellus shale for about $1.24 billion to a unit of Alta Resources Development LLC.

column4: Ono warns on profit after government halves price of cancer drug Opdivo
column5: TOKYO Ono Pharmaceutical Co cut its annual profit outlook by a quarter on Wednesday  hit by the Japanese government's decision to halve the price of cancer drug Opdivo that it co-developed with Bristol Myers Squibb Co.

column4: BAT nears takeover of Bosnian FDS tobacco business
column5: SARAJEVO An Austrian fund backed by British American Tobacco  agreed to increase its stake in Bosnian holding firm Fabrika Duhana Sarajevo (FDS)  to 78.8 percent  paving the way for BAT to acquire FDS's tobacco assets.

column4: Goldman Sachs to pay $120 million over attempted ISDAFIX benchmark manipulation
column5: WASHINGTON Goldman Sachs Group Inc  will pay a $120 million penalty to resolve civil charges that it attempted to manipulate a global benchmark for interest rate products known on Wall Street as "ISDAFIX " U.S. derivatives regulators said Wednesday.

column4: Goldman Sachs ordered to pay $120 million penalty for rate manipulation: CFTC
column5: WASHINGTON Goldman Sachs has been ordered to pay a $120 million civil penalty to settle charges that it often tried to manipulate a global dollar benchmark for interest rate products over a five-year period  the Commodity Futures Trading Commission said on Wednesday.

column4: Hershey names COO Michele Buck as chief executive
column5: U.S. chocolate maker Hershey Co  named Chief Operating Officer Michele Buck as its chief executive and president  pinning its hopes on a company veteran to build on a recovery in demand in North America.

column4: Kinder Morgan wins dismissal of $171 million investor lawsuit
column5: WILMINGTON  Del. The Delaware Supreme Court dismissed on Tuesday a $171 million investor lawsuit against Kinder Morgan Inc stemming from the pipeline operator's acquisition of El Paso Corp and its affiliates.

column4: Petrobras to sell Total $2.2 billion worth of assets  including oilfields
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Petroleo Brasileiro SA said on Wednesday it will sell $2.2 billion worth of assets to France's Total SA  including stakes in oilfields and two thermal power stations.

column4: Swiss convict Brazilian companies in Petrobras scandal
column5: ZURICH Switzerland's Office of the Attorney General has convicted the Brazilian company Odebrecht SA and one of its subsidiaries of inadequate corporate organization in connection with the Petrobras affair  it said on Wednesday.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras hires KPMG as auditor  replacing PwC
column5: SAO PAULO Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA has appointed KPMG as its new auditing firm for three years starting in 2017  replacing PricewaterhouseCoopers  Petrobras said in a securities filing on Wednesday. [KPMG.UL]

column4: U.S. executions hit 25-year low as capital punishment wanes: study
column5: AUSTIN  Texas The number of U.S. executions fell to a quarter-century low in 2016 as new death sentences plummeted  indicating capital punishment is on the decline  a study released on Wednesday showed.

column4: Linde  Praxair agree $65 billion merger outline  ambitious cost savings
column5: FRANKFURT German industrial gases group Linde  and U.S. suitor Praxair  have agreed an outline for a $65 billion-plus merger  with the combined company to be run out of the United States by Praxair's chief executive. | Video

column4: RBS near to selling $600 million of shipping loans: sources
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland is close to selling at least $600 million worth of shipping loans from its portfolio  two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

column4: Actelion shares gain on report of progress in Sanofi talks
column5: ZURICH Swiss biotech group Actelion's  shares rose by more than 3 percent on Wednesday following a report that talks with Sanofi  are making progress  increasing optimism that the two will strike a deal.

column4: State Street tests blockchain system for securities lending
column5: NEW YORK State Street Corp  has tested a blockchain system that it hopes can be used to streamline the securities lending process as the financial industry accelerates efforts to adopt the emerging technology.

column4: Stone Energy reaches bankruptcy deal with shareholders
column5: Offshore oil exploration company Stone Energy Corp   which filed for bankruptcy last week  has agreed to increase the potential recovery for shareholders in its Chapter 11 plan  according to court papers filed on Wednesday.

column4: Petrobras to sell Total $2.2 billion worth of assets  including oilfields
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Petroleo Brasileiro SA said on Wednesday it will sell $2.2 billion worth of assets to France's Total SA  including stakes in oilfields and two thermal power stations.

column4: Hacker group takes over Netflix Twitter account
column5: One of Netflix Inc's  Twitter accounts was hacked on Wednesday by an entity calling itself "OurMine".

column4: Disney will create shows for Snapchat
column5: The Walt Disney Company’s U.S. television arm will create shows for Snap Inc’s Snapchat  Disney announced on Wednesday  in Snapchat's latest deal with a major U.S. media company.
